headline.main: Excerpts From Statement on Drug Abuse Heard by Senate Panel on Delinquency

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 6 -Following are excerpts from the statement today before the Senate Subcommittee on Juvenile Delinquency by Dr. Stanley F. Yolles, director of the National Institute of Mental Health:

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 4 -- President Johnson asked Congress today to help him in new efforts to reduce "inexcusably" high rates of infant mortality, to train more doctors and to strike at "unacceptable" costs of drugs and hospital care.

headline.main: Johnson Health Plan Asks Stress on Doctor Training; President's Health Plan Stresses Doctor Training

docs.abstract: Pres Johnson asks Cong approve $58-million increase in funds for child health care, in part to cut 'inexcusably' high infant mortality rate, special message to Cong; seeks to provide prenatal and postnatal care for some 700,000 'needy' mothers by 73, other services through Child Health Act of '68
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 4 -- President Johnson asked Congress today to help him in new efforts to reduce "inexcusably" high rates of infant mortality, to train more doctors and to strike at "unacceptable" costs of drugs and hospital care.

docs.lead_paragraph: A middle-aged man came to the Headache Unit at Montefiore Hospital with an unusual problem. He was suffering from recurring headaches, but his headaches "recurred" only on Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's Day.

headline.main: Headaches: A $400-Million Problem; Headaches: $400-Million-a-Year Problem for Many Americans

docs.abstract: Article on prevalence, research, treatment, headache remedies; diagram of tension headache
docs.snippet: A middle-aged man came to the Headache Unit at Montefiore Hospital with an unusual problem. He was suffering from recurring headaches, but his headaches "recurred" only on Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's Day.
